intro: Streptanthus glandulosus var. albidus, commonly known as the white-stemmed winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open areas, often in coastal regions, and has glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge, while its fruit is a dry, segmented capsule. This variety is distinguished by its pale coloration and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
